title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that Malaysia is inefficiently using its resources and/or does not explain that it is producing at a point inside its production possibilities curve.
The response states that Malaysia is inefficiently using its resources and explains that it is producing at a point inside its production possibilities curve.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that Malaysia has the comparative advantage in the production of electronics and/or does not explain that Malaysia has the lower opportunity cost in producing electronics: the opportunity cost of producing one unit of electronics in Malaysia is 0.1 unit of cars and in Japan it is 0.25 unit of cars.

The response states that Malaysia has the comparative advantage in the production of electronics and explains that Malaysia has the lower opportunity cost in producing electronics: the opportunity cost of producing one unit of electronics in Malaysia is 0.1 unit of cars and in Japan it is 0.25 unit of cars.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that yes, these terms of trade are mutually beneficial and/or does not explain that these terms of trade fall between the two countries’ opportunity costs (i.e., between 4 and 10 units of electronics).

The response states that yes, these terms of trade are mutually beneficial and explains that these terms of trade fall between the two countries’ opportunity costs (i.e., between 4 and 10 units of electronics).

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that Japan has the absolute advantage in the production of cars and/or does not explain that after the production of cars doubles, Japan can produce a maximum of 50 cars and Malaysia can produce a maximum of 20 cars with the same amount of resources.

The response states that Japan has the absolute advantage in the production of cars and explains that after the production of cars doubles, Japan can produce a maximum of 50 cars and Malaysia can produce a maximum of 20 cars with the same amount of resources.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not calculate the number of unemployed people in Japan as 28 million and/or does not show the work.
